comments.body: I love the bonemealing part as, at the moment, coral is a limited resource. This would make it farmable on a large scale without ruining the pristine feel of the coral reef.
I was just about to suggest this exact thing!
Sean P me too!

Good ideas! I want to grow a reef in the ocean near my base, but can't because of the tedious process of getting said coral. I would love for coral to be treated as an "underwater tree", potentially also being able to craft a block with 9 fans/coral plants (and vice versa) would be great!
Maybe instead of a stick you should use a blaze rod or a bone not sure but more weopons with unique effects are always welcome.
what
what

Sorry, I couldn’t add my post, I think because of yours, so I’m posting it as a comment on yours.

I think that it would be interesting to have more types of stone. The stones I think should be added are pumice, shale, talc, and limestone. These could all be used to make stone tools (including the stone types already in game) and depending on the type of stone, how much durability the tool has. Shale could be mixed with water to make clay. Talc could make white dye. Pumice could be used to scrub stuff like removing moss from mossy blocks. Crushed shale and limestone could be used to make cement.

Hey guys if you're reading please go vote on this page:
https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360047910232-Brick-and-pillar-versions-of-andesite-diorite-and-granite
It's the same suggestion (more stone brick types), but has the most votes so if we all vote for this one, the devs will see it. Thanks!

Gneis, Bims und Mamor hinzuzufügen ist eine gute Idee. Gneis und Bims würden wie Andesit oder Diorit generieren. Marmor wäre aber seltener und würde von der Höhe -25 - +25 generieren. Außerdem würde man für Marmor vom Handeln mit Villagern doppelt so viele Smaragte wie bei Andesit erhalten. Es sollte auch eine gemeiselte Version von jeder Steinart exestieren.

Not bad, But I don't think that any changes to ink sacks are necessary, since squid ink is already a staining fluid. I also don't see why Cactus green needs to change past a name change since green dye is simply crafted with cactus green

I've edited my original post. I kept my original ideas for black dye; I like them because although it's true that ink sacs are already a stainable fluid, squids should really only drop one at a time, as mentioned in my post.

I have, however, refined my ideas for green dye. Now, I propose that cacti yield nopales when put through a Stonecutter. Nopales can be eaten, smelted into green dye, or used as the ingredient for blindness potions (see my Reform of the Potions post for information on that).

I understand where you are going with this, but to be honest for me it's hard enough to get ink sacs, and i live by the ocean. Instead, this is what should happen.

A) Make an Ink Sac craftable into two black dye. I completely support that part of the idea, if it was just that i would vote for it.

B) Make Squids (and maybe dolphins) breedable. I would love to see how some players would tackle the idea of underwater farms, plus this would provide a much cleaner way of obtaining Ink Sacs when you need the actual Sac. (To trade with villagers, etc)  

C)  Make Squids attachable with leads. This would make it much easier to move them around, or bring them to your farm.

Also Mojang, please keep the looting and spawn rates as is for squids. Thank You!

I had an idea that kind of contradicts yours, but I'll put it out anyway to see what you think:

Squids (and as of the newest snapshot, glow squids) have a limited number of sacs, say 4-6.  Each time you hit a squid, it releases ink, using up one sac.  By the time you kill it, it drops the number of sacs it has left.  This would be interesting since it would require players to find quicker ways of killing squid so that they get the most ink.  Over time, perhaps squid could refill their sacs, but since squids are a come-and-go mob that despawn all the time and are replaced by others, I don't think this would be necessary.
why would you make the game less fun just for "realism" farming ink is not fun
Unnecessary, wood is very easy to obtain to make charcoal.

I could see it being continuous for using the full block to make charcoal, which is pretty easy to datapack if Mojang disagrees, given that in a typical game there's another wood type not to far from spawn.
This is a great idea. Bamboo is more easily farmable. Plus some servers banned tnt duping, so u cant use wood farms. Thats ehy bamboo wood should be able to smelt into charcoal.
I think it would be great seeing how easy it is to make an automatic bamboo farm. I really hope they add this to the game one day.

This would be extremely useful for torch farms. In order to automatically harvest trees you need to blow them up. If I could use bamboo I would only need a piston, so I could hook a bamboo farm to a torch farm and have it be much smaller.
If bamboo blocks are being treated like wood blocks and are able to be used as fuel then they should also be able to be burnt into charcoal just like wood blocks.
Looks cool! Please add it to minecraft, make copper more useful!
That sounds like too cool! Definitely!

That's actually a pretty unique take on the idea that i didn't consider. I was just gonna come in and suggest they toggle like copper bulbs (One signal opens them, another signal closes them) but this is a much more interesting idea if you ask me and is a great way to give it functionality similar to that of iron doors while also drastically setting them apart and making for an interesting mechanic to boot!
I think its the most reasonable way to give them a unique feature easy enough. Oxidation should have some role too, but this could be their interaction with redstone.

I was here to suggest exactly this.

It feels off, that a copper door would have the same behavior as a wooden or iron door.
I was thinking the same thing but i said add nets and jars being able to place jars with fireflys for brightness or a jar with a frog in it catching it in a net automatically puts it into a jar.
One could also use bottled fireflies to move them from swamp biomes to another biome!
This would be an AWESOME item to have in game! I'm already hyped about them in general for the atmosphere itself, but I would LOVE to have a use for them as well!
This is a great idea

This could be great! I would like it if the journey to get the dark beacon would be kind of like finding the pieces of it in each ancient city. Basically, you’d have to go to multiple cities, and maybe there’d only be one or two pieces in each city.
Awesome Idea
gr8

I was thinking something like this, but in the form of a redstone "rod". Redstone power applied to any of the bottom sides of the rod travels to blocks adjacent to the top (or vice versa). The rods would be stackable, of course. A recipe of a middle column of redstone powder (or blocks, if you wanna make it more expensive) would work nicely.
that would be really cool
Concrete stairs and slabs?! Now you are speaking my language!
tasty

its been ages since a proper food (excluding glow berries, sweet berries) as been added and i would definatly like to see it but its very unlikely we will ever see things like this even though alot of the items are in the game too so there is no reason why it cant be done
Finally someone else recognizes cakes and pies!

The current cake texture looks as though it is red velvet, even though you don't put red dye or chocolate in the crafting recipe.  There should definitely be more types of cake, and the frosting textures could be different.
I think that idea is great, I hope they accept it
Ok boomer
And you should be able to store books in them
And you could change the amount of books in the shelf
I think there should be be that aswell, it would really help it blend into different types of builds.
Would be really cool, especially if the books textures changed as well, might be able to have a more diverse looking library
concrete bricks stairs and slabs would be veryyyy nice
Shouldn't this be put in the redstone category?
I just came across the exact same idea. It`s just such a perfect aesthetic addition to the game. Simple and fun. Definitely something Microsoft should put a few minutes into.
I'd honestly be down for a straw hat even it didn't do anything special.

I've always wanted to wear those, or the cozy looking snowy villager hats.

Maybe the harvesting bonus would be an enchantment
The crafting recipe for an empty cup could be a single piece of wood with a stick next to it

Thats a great idea! I thinking the same.

The game needs tea as you say. It will immerse the game more. Like players who creating asian theme towns/cities and villages will be grateful for this item I think. Can you imagine a right tea shop in the village and behind it tea plantations?? Gosh I just wish devs make it done.

If you also could make different tea - like black tea, green tea and matcha - all of them add different bonus. That would be kinda cool.

Adding rice and rice fields would be also great idea, as someone else in another post mentioned.

This is a very good idea, I would say that the crafting recipe will require 1 gunpowder and 1 sand, since it's basically a smaller version of TNT. For the sake of balance though, perhaps the throwing of it will need the player to hold and time it for a direct explosion hit and max damage. They would also need a flint n steel in their left hand.
I had the same idea, I hope this comes into the game eventually

I think it should be a string on top, sand, then gunpowder. I think that it should operate like the trident: the longer you hold it, the farther it goes. Maybe if you hold it for too long it explodes.
I think it should be crafted with string and tnt 4-8 pieces
Great idea! In real life Dynamite is made by wrapping paper around explosives so Dynamite could be made by wrapping 4 pieces of paper around 1 gun powder! The explosion strength would be 1.
I think it should also be found in mineshafts.

Renewability, or at least ubiquity, of blocks and items is paramount when playing on a server. Its never fun to join a server and the good stuff has been snapped up, requiring long trips or pure luck to obtain them, or even sometimes be simply out of luck.

There have also been suggestions elsewhere to have dripstone renew calcite and either Tuff or Basalt depending on if water or lava is above the block.

Either way itd be a good way to get more of these blocks.
Creative idea. I like it!
Consider moving it to cave & cliffs?
I think this makes sense, because in real life it is hard to recognize people through tinted glass. That's why tinted glass exists.
What if they were only found in a crystal biome? Or if they could be made with amethyst?
They should be a food source that can be found in all sorts of caves and only found as an ore.
talking about a good fantasy food source! this would be way better than eating mushrooms, spider eyes, rotten flesh or bats...
i thought you meant candy made out of stone and i was like *facesmack*
o trocitos de adoquín

I think this is a great idea because you can see if a player's account is really new, or really old. People who played minecraft since the 1.0.0 update might have like, golden or ender capes. It'd be really cool to see this in the game.

I agree and have been trying to spread an idea like this. I registered in early 2010 and I'm absolutely devastated that I'm losing my connection Minecraft Classic. Especially after I lost access to my account during the first Mojang account migration. It took me so long to regain access and now it just feels like a waste.
This is an amazing idea i was just about to post it myself!
I think it should be an item frame made out of glass not sticks
I've seen stuff about renaming, shearing, or invisibility potions to make the frames invisible. I like the shears idea because it's easy in survival. The frames also go visible when empty
I say yes as long as they add this to pocket addition also.
of course, minecraft could always use more parity
Good idea
